contentrichtext.text: [[Image:Flavio Cotti.jpg|thumb|Flavio Cotti]] '''Flavio Cotti''' (born 18 October 1939, in [[Prato-Sornico]]) is a [[Switzerland|Swiss]] [[politician]]. He was elected to the [[Federal Council of Switzerland]] on 10 December 1986 and handed over office on 30 April 1999. He is affiliated to the [[Christian Democratic People's Party of Switzerland]]. During his office time he held the following departments: *[[Department of Home Affairs (Switzerland)|Federal Department of Home Affairs]] (1987–1993) *[[Federal Department of Foreign Affairs]] (1994–1999) He was [[President of the Confederation (Switzerland)|President of the Confederation]] twice, first in 1991 and then again in 1998. ==External links== *{{HDS|4738}} *{{Swiss Federal Councillor|100}} *{{DNB portal|119075555|TYP=}} {{s-start}} {{succession box | before = [[Alphons Egli]] | title = [[Member of the Swiss Federal Council]] | years = 1986–1999 | after = [[Joseph Deiss]]}} {{s-end}} {{Swiss Presidents}} {{Authority control|VIAF=62350333}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Cotti, Flavio | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Swiss politician | DATE OF BIRTH = 18 October 1939 | PLACE OF BIRTH = [[Prato-Sornico]] | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Cotti, Flavio}} [[Category:1939 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Members of the Swiss Federal Council]] [[Category:People from Ticino]] [[Category:Swiss Roman Catholics]] {{Switzerland-politician-stub}}
